title: The Queen's success is thanks, in part, to royal aide and dresser Angela Kelly
text:
It often seems that appearance is everything these days, but the way that the Queen presents herself to millions around the world is truly a matter of great importance. Her Majesty’s image is always uplifting yet never frivolous, always regal yet never flashy (unless it is an occasion which calls for full finery, of course). Her aide, the royal dresser-in-chief Angela Kelly, makes it all look effortless.

Kelly’s new book, The Other Side of the Coin: The Queen, the Dresser and the Wardrobe, is released today, sharing unique personal stories and insight into the way the Queen gets dressed for globally-viewed occasions.
